page.title: 19Language
page.content: The people in our area speak in the Buchan dialect,here is part of a poem by Kathleen Smith. {The Fishin' Boat She mak's her way oot o'the harbour Afore we're up an' aboot Maist mornin's in spite o' the weather The crew mak's sure she's oot. {She's nae sae young as she used tae be {Bit she's fairly wearin' weel {The skipper's gettin' on a bit an' a' {Though he can still haul a creel. So maist days,through rain or shine The yawl mak's oot tae sea Ye'll see the FR 49 Wi' her valiant crew o' three. {Oot tae haul up a'their creels {Tae catch a parten or twa {An' if they're afa lucky chiels {They'll get a few labsters an' a'.
